members.member:
HWMenu WebControl.
[History("mario@hartmann.net", "2003/06/14", "use of named CSS styles added")]

member.name: F:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.MenuFramesVertical
member.summary: Frames in cols or rows 1 or 0

member.name: F:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.TakeOverBgColor
member.summary: Menu frame takes over background color subitem frame

member.name: F:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.HideTop
member.summary: Hide first level when loading new document 1 or 0

member.name: F:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.RightToLeft
member.summary: enables/ disables right to left unfold 1 or 0

member.name: F:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.WebMasterCheck
member.summary: menu tree checking on or off 1 or 0

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.ToMenuArray(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a string representing the current menu array

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.GetClientScriptPath
member.summary: GetClientScriptPath() method -- works out the location of the shared scripts and images.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores the view-state information from a previous user control request that was saved by the method.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.SaveViewState
member.summary: Saves any user control view-state changes that have occurred since the last page postback.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.TrackViewState
member.summary: Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's StateBag object. This object is accessible through the property.

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.ControlItemStyle
member.summary: Style of this element when the mouse is not over the element.

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.ControlHiStyle
member.summary: Style of this element when the mouse is over the element.

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.ControlSubStyle
member.summary: Style of tSubs element when the mouse is not over the element.

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.Menu.ControlHiSubStyle
member.summary: Style of the Subs element when the mouse is over the element.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores the view-state information from a previous user control request that was saved by the method.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.SaveViewState
member.summary: Saves any user control view-state changes that have occurred since the last page postback.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.TrackViewState
member.summary: Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's StateBag object. This object is accessible through the property.

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.ToMenuArray
member.summary: Retrieves a string representing the current menu array

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.ControlHiStyle
member.summary: Style of this element when the mouse is over the element.

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.Text
member.summary: What you want to show in the element. It can be text, an image or html. To show an image Text will be look like "" To use roll over images use "rollover:MyImage1:MyImage2"

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.Link
member.summary: Text string- Where you want to go when you click the element. Looks like "MyLink" Can also be used to execute javascript statements. For instance when you want the link to open in the top window use "javascript:top.document.location.href='Link.htm';" You can in fact start a whole script when the element is clicked with the help of javascript:. "javascript:{your script; another function;}"

member.name: P:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Background image for the element. Is not supported for NS4 when the menu is across frames. I had to disable this for NS4 in frame setup because I could not get it to work properly. (Everybody who wants to try and find a solution for this is very welcome. Enable in menu_com.js)

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNodes.Add(DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNode)
member.summary: Adds a MenuTreeNode item to the collection

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNodes.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an object to the collection (must be of type MenuTreeNode)

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNodes.ToMenuArray(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a string representing the current menu array

member.name: M:DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNodes.ToMenuArray(System.String,DUEMETRI.UI.WebControls.HWMenu.MenuTreeNodes)
member.summary: Retrieves a string representing the current menu array
